result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven R Bjork was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Impairment of Physical Condition, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Impairment of Physical Condition, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Sentence is imposed and stayed, if imposed defendant is granted huber priveleges and 60 days to pay any outstanding financial obligations as ordered by the Court.
Consecutive to: Stayed sentence if imposed is to run consecutive on counts 1,2&3 in this case

The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.  Defendant was ordered to report immediately to the probation and parole office.
Concurrent with: Probation in counts 1,2&3 to run concurrent to each other as are the conditions thereof

miscConds.notes:
Costs to be paid on a schedule established by the agent. Bond of $250.00 previously posted applied
9-9-2015 probation revoked, sentence imposed, remaining financial obligations due within 60 days

Defendant shall attend counseling/programing as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request  

Defendant shall not possess or consume any medication or drug except as may be specifically prescribed by a medical professional for defendant, and then shall be taken only as prescribed.

Defendant is to follow all Doctors/medical professionals orders

Defendant is to undergo a Psychological evaluation/assessment if not already done and releasing all records of current or past evaluations to the agent.
Defendant is not to have any violent or otherwise disorderly contact with  Kristin Bjork.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

for no contact to be lifted-to be considered at the next hearing.
Bail/bond hearing on July 16, 2014 at 03:50 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Steven R Bjork
Current: 124 N Andrews Ave, Greenwood, WI 54437 United States  (Effective: 06-06-2014)
Prior: N7263 Cty Rd G, Neillsville, WI 54456
Initial appearance on July 16, 2014 at 03:50 pm.

The defendant shall have no contact with K.L.B.  of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way. Third party contact is allowed one time only to arrange for retrieval of personal belongings
AMENDED The no contact with K.L.B. is amended to no violent, abusive or disorderly conduct with K.L.B.

District Attorney Lyndsey A Boon Brunette appeared on behalf of the State;  Defendant appeared in person, pro se,  via video conference from Clark County Jail, State request cash bond, defendant request signature bond.  Defendant advised of right to an attorney, defendant is undecided whether to get an attorney.  Initial appearance scheduled for July 16, 2014 at 03:50 pm.
